name: NCD - Diagnosis and Treatment of Impotence
description: Impotence is a failure of a body part for which the diagnosis, and frequently the treatment, require medical expertise. Depending on the cause of the condition, treatment may be surgical; e.g., implantation of a penile prosthesis, or nonsurgical; e.g., medical or psychotherapeutic treatment.

restrictions.condition: Patient has been diagnosed with impotence.
Patient is receiving treatment for impotence.
Surgical implantation of a penile prosthesis is a covered treatment option.
Nonsurgical medical treatment for impotence is a covered option.
Nonsurgical psychotherapeutic treatment for impotence is a covered option.
Documentation of appropriateness may be requested if abuse related to the condition or treatment is suspected.
Treatment for impotence is furnished in connection with a mental condition.
The patient receiving treatment in connection with a mental condition is not a hospital inpatient.
The psychiatric service limitation applies if treatment is furnished to patients (other than hospital inpatients) in connection with a mental condition.
